programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Auctions in Costa Mesa bring out the best and worst in the buyers as they go all out to score a fortune from a great locker.

programme.title: Auction Hunters
programme.desc: On a visit to San Bernardino, California, Ton Jones uncovers a Victorian pepper-box revolver - but the weapon will only turn a profit if he manages to make it capable of firing.

programme.title: Auction Hunters
programme.desc: Allen Haff and Ton Jones head to downtown Los Angeles, and whilst bidding on storage units uncover a rare copper cash converter and a 1970s German H&K P7 pistol.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: Victor sets his sights on a scooter that could be worth 3,000 dollars, and Lesa spots a snake-skin ensemble.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: One of the buyers accidentally acquires a historically important item, while Victor gets his hands on an intriguing locked treasure chest - with no key.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: Rick restores an antique towel steamer from a 19th-century barbershop and a 1950s television.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: Pawn Stars' Rick Harrison seeks the team's help in making a couch out of a car as a birthday present for his son.

programme.title: Swamp People
programme.desc: RJ and Jay Paul take a hard line on those setting lines directly across from theirs, a direct violation of the code of the swamp. Troy takes a special vessel called a 'gator tail' to a favoured catching point, where even an unexpected obstacle fails to prevent him trying to fill his boat.

programme.title: Ernie the Wildman
programme.desc: Turtleman deals with a skunk, using layers of armour to protect himself against its toxic fumes.

programme.title: Ernie the Wildman
programme.desc: Ernie Brown Jr rescues a calf that has fallen down a sinkhole. Plus, a huge creature lurking in a family's pond.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: As Christmas approaches, the staff members look over alleged American revolutionary war currency and a battleaxe.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Staff are offered a steak dinner and a cash prize as an incentive to boost profits, and a 1915 calculator and some 200-year-old buttons are brought in.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: Big Mike brings a 1960s motorcycle into the shop, and the guys search for rare parts to restore it, while Rick works on an arcade game.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: The team turns a petrol pump into a beer cooler and restore a sign from a 1970s fast food restaurant.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Investigations into whether prophets such as Elijah and Joseph Smith communicated with a heavenly source, or came into contact with extraterrestrials.

programme.title: Hangar 1: The UFO Files
programme.desc: Theorists investigate the history of submersible UFOs, and their potential underwater hangars, in light of claims that suggest there could be as many alien crafts dwelling beneath the sea as their are reported in the sky.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: The bidders consider the benefits and drawbacks of two very different neighbourhoods, and Lesa displays her ruthless side while dealing with a young buyer.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: A piano, a tea set and some expensive furniture are among the finds up for grabs when the buyers go to Lewisville, Texas.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: When the security guards start spooking customers, Les sends them home to teach them a lesson.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Les makes a major deal with a new supplier for a truckload of TVs, before getting excited about rare Detroit Tigers baseball memorabilia.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Corey considers buying a flawed 1996 Harley Road King motorcycle, and the team examines knives dating back to the Second World War.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The team examines a German bayonet from the Second World War, and Richard takes a gamble with a 1930s slot machine.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Auctions in Lake Elsinore bring treasures for some and turmoil for others, Dave causes trouble for his rivals, and Rene and Jarrod go head to head.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: The buyers head to auctions in Santa Ana, and once back on familiar turf, Dave Hester makes the others fight for a decent locker.

programme.title: Auction Hunters
programme.desc: Ton Jones and Allen Haff try to make a profit by selling a 19th-century Colt Peacemaker pistol, a Depression-era slot machine and a customised mini-bike.

programme.title: Auction Hunters
programme.desc: The traders discover a valuable 1970s Fender Stratocaster guitar and a rare Schwinn bicycle from the 1930s.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: The buyers go to Dallas, where they attend several auctions in one day while facing a frantic race to keep up with the competition.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: Ricky and Bubba buy a locker full of valuable sci-fi merchandise, while Victor makes a spectacular profit on his latest purchase.

programme.title: Air Crash: Disasters Uncovered
programme.desc: Blow Out.

programme.title: Hangar 1: The UFO Files
programme.desc: Experts from the Mutual UFO Network explore intriguing reports of UFO sightings over battlefields, examining evidence from some of the 70,000 case files hidden away in an Ohio warehouse called Hangar 1.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: The hundreds of gigantic lines, some in the shape of animals, geometric patterns and even an alien-like being, that extend for several miles throughout a remote Peruvian desert. Known as the Nazca Lines, some theorists believe the markings have an extraterrestrial connection, and that the ancient people of the region possibly created these figures in tribute to the gods who visited them.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Corey looks for a good deal for a 1901 Edison phonograph, and Rick assesses the value of a set of small sculptures cast in solid gold but painted black.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The staff get the chance to buy a rare 1970s Indian mini-motorcycle.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.sub-title: Too Many Cooks in the Locker
programme.desc: The buyers try their luck at auctions in Lancaster, where Mary chooses a surprising ally. Meanwhile, Jarrod and Brandi turn up the pressure.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Dave threatens to dampen high spirits at an early morning auction, and Mary struggles to stop the other buyers from getting her down.

programme.title: Auction Hunters
programme.desc: Ton Jones and Allen Haff run into an old rival at a storage auction, and also acquire a vintage GMC truck and a contraption that could be the first ever Coca-Cola vending machine.

programme.title: Auction Hunters
programme.desc: The traders head to Hollywood, where they try to make a profit by selling a set of vintage Masonic swords, a polygraph machine and a Second World War samurai blade.

programme.title: Paranormal: Caught on Camera
programme.desc: An Oregon man shoots some incredible Bigfoot footage, UFOs gather over Texas and an active poltergeist appears in Wales.

programme.title: Paranatural
programme.desc: Experts investigate the alleged power of foresight and ask whether prophets really can predict disastrous events.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Auctions in Lake Elsinore bring treasures for some and turmoil for others, Dave causes trouble for his rivals, and Rene and Jarrod go head to head.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: The buyers head to auctions in Santa Ana, and once back on familiar turf, Dave Hester makes the others fight for a decent locker.

programme.title: Hypothetical
programme.desc: Angela Barnes, Guz Khan, Tom Davis and Harriet Kemsley are posed increasingly absurd hypothetical situations. Hosted by Josh Widdicombe and James Acaster.

programme.title: Taskmaster
programme.desc: Jessica Knappett beautifully mimics a funny noise, Phil Wang makes ogres poignant despite his eye-catching costume and James Acaster finds various circles.

programme.title: Have I Got a Bit More News for You
programme.desc: Gary Lineker hosts an extended edition of the satirical quiz, with panellists Ross Noble and Samira Ahmed joining team captains Ian Hislop and Paul Merton.

programme.title: Jon Richardson: Ultimate Worrier
programme.desc: This time, Jon is joined by Sara Pascoe and Joe Wilkinson as they attempt to analyse and assess the things that worry them the most about the body.

programme.title: Zapped
programme.desc: Brian pitches for a job in the pub while Herman helps an old warrior friend. Barbara finds herself in charge of the Munty Pet show, which Howell is attempting to fix.

programme.title: The Indestructibles
programme.desc: Gendle and Tim have two wheelie bins full of junk and just three days to create a spectacular moment with a pro athlete.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Cops UK: Bodycam Squad
programme.desc: A man calls 999 claiming his car has been stolen, but when the vehicle turns up crashed into a wall with cans of cider in the footwell, James is suspicious to say the least.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: The guys stumble on the mother lode of Americana in Maryland and a former garbage man's trash is a real treasure.

programme.title: Storage Hunters UK
programme.desc: Sean Kelly and the hunters are off to Leeds, where a new pair of bidders arrive - and they are not afraid to throw their weight around. Meanwhile, Sam and Ione re-ignite their feud.

programme.title: Storage Hunters UK
programme.desc: Sean Kelly oversees UK bidders looking for treasures in Ipswich. With Heavy D back in town the bargaining buccaneers are being driven mad by the booming bidder.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Frank celebrates his birthday with a picking bonanza, and the guys make a widow's dreams come true by brokering a deal to honour her husband.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Mike struggles to free a massive vintage sign from a tight corner and the guys strike a seemingly impossible deal with the 'Sign Boss'.

programme.title: Timber Kings
programme.desc: Beat heads to Alberta and Joel proves no request is too big when he pulls out all the stops to deliver a giant walk through tree and an elaborate totem pole.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson, Richard Hammond and James May build their own stretch limousines out of other vehicles and use them to transport celebrities to the Brit Awards. Meanwhile, a Ford Mustang is put through its paces, and actress Billie Piper is the Star in a Reasonably Priced Car.

programme.title: Cops UK: Bodycam Squad
programme.desc: Two males on bikes are spotted acting suspiciously near a cashpoint. One evades police and a pursuit ensues. A police dog undertakes its final shift.

programme.title: Sin City Motors
programme.desc: Major body work is needed when the suspension and engine don't fit the Haunted Rod. Steve flips a 1920 Old Wayne Gas Pump to offset extra labour costs.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson, Richard Hammond and James May compete in a 1950s-style race from London to Edinburgh. On the footplate of the A1 Tornado steam train, Jeremy has to feed the boiler with a constant supply of coal, while Richard braves the saddle of a Vincent Black Shadow motorbike and James drives an old Jaguar XK120 as the trio discover what Top Gear might have been like 60 years ago. Michael Schumacher drives the Reasonably Priced Car.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Richard Hammond, Jeremy Clarkson and James May try to find the perfect car for 17-year-olds, dealing with insurance companies, accident repairs and a muddy music festival car park in the process. Richard also visits Abu Dhabi to test the Lamborghini Murcielago SV and stages a race between the 1000hp Bugatti Veyron and the McLaren F1. Actor, writer and comedian Stephen Fry is the Star in a Reasonably Priced Car.

programme.title: Taskmaster
programme.desc: Rhod Gilbert force-feeds Alex Horne a jug of mocha, Kerry Godliman hits a cricket ball with a croquet mallet, and Phil Wang makes a really strange noise.

programme.title: Room 101
programme.desc: Former Happy Mondays frontman Shaun Ryder, comedian and actress Meera Syal and Australian stand-up Sam Simmons tell Frank Skinner what really gets on their wick, in the hope he will banish their bugbears to the infamous room for ever. The celebrities' gripes include football talk, boisterous whistling and severe makeover shows.

programme.title: Room 101
programme.desc: Strictly host Claudia Winkleman, broadcaster John Humphrys and comedian Russell Kane tell Frank Skinner what really gets on their wick, in the hope he will banish their bugbears to the infamous room for ever. The celebrities' gripes include skiing, summer, whooping in audiences and fussy eaters.

programme.title: Have I Got a Bit More News for You
programme.sub-title: Have I Got a Bit More Old News for You
programme.desc: Extended edition. Comedian, writer and actress Katherine Ryan guest hosts the satirical quiz, with stand-up Joe Wilkinson and broadcaster and writer Gyles Brandreth joining regular team captains Paul Merton and Ian Hislop to poke fun at the week's news.

programme.title: QI
programme.desc: Stephen Fry is joined by guests Sean Lock, David Mitchell, Danny Baker and regular panellist Alan Davies on the quiz with a difference. Correctness and even intelligence go out of the window as the host asks questions about hoaxes, and awards points for the answers he finds the most interesting.

programme.title: Hypothetical
programme.desc: Nish Kumar, Jen Brister, Rob Beckett and Lou Sanders are posed increasingly absurd hypothetical situations. Hosted by Josh Widdicombe and James Acaster.

programme.title: Dara O Briain's Go 8 Bit
programme.desc: Guests Gregg Wallace and Jodie Kidd play a series of video games, including Spy Hunter, Total War: Rome II and Battlefield 1.

programme.title: Porridge
programme.desc: Betting fever sweeps Slade Prison, but the stakes rise too high for some of the inmates, stretching honour among thieves to the limit. Vintage comedy, starring Ronnie Barker and Richard Beckinsale.

programme.title: Porridge
programme.desc: Fletcher helps cellmate Godber make it through the night, calling on his unpredictable and limitless imagination to while away the hours. Classic comedy, starring Ronnie Barker and Richard Beckinsale.

programme.title: Nazi Victory: The Post-War Plan
programme.desc: A look at Hitler's plans to build ambitious new cities in the countries he conquered, as well as schemes to transform Berlin to serve as a global capital city.

programme.title: The British Middle Class
programme.desc: Historian and broadcaster Tristram Hunt examines the social class's origins. He discovers how the backlash against the landed aristocracy began with a group of radical thinkers who craved progress and used their money from industry to begin a process of urban enlightenment. However, the growth of mass production led the newly moneyed leaders to move further away from the factories, beginning the trend for suburban living as a mark of status - though it meant the middle classes turning their back on where they came from.

programme.title: David Attenborough's Natural Curiosities
programme.desc: David Attenborough highlights the curiosities that have led to accusations of forgery, but have ultimately helped assist the rethinking of evolution. When early explorers brought the first specimen of a duck-billed platypus to England in 1799, it was considered so bizarre it was deemed a hoax. Similarly, the midwife toad became the centre of a scientific storm in the 1920s that led to accusations of fakery.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Ronnie Kray and the Pervert Peer
programme.desc: Fifty years ago, the Kray twins rose from small-time racketeers to head the most powerful criminal organisation London had ever seen. This documentary about the affinity between the upper echelons of society and the criminal underclass reveals how they built their empire on fear, violence and extortion - as well as Ronnie's alleged homosexual relationship with a prominent Tory peer.

programme.title: Secrets of the Railways
programme.desc: Documentary looking at railroads constructed during history's most turbulent periods, now associated with some of mankind's ugliest deeds. Beginning with the Trans-Pyrenees Railway.

programme.title: Forbidden History
programme.sub-title: In Search of the Real King Arthur
programme.desc: Jamie Theakston investigates the truth behind the legend of King Arthur, and looks for evidence of whether the mythical monarch was English, Scottish or Welsh.

programme.title: Secret Nazi Bases
programme.desc: A mile-and-a half of recently-excavated trenches, bunkers, barracks, and gun encasements near Pointe du Hoc, which tell a new story of D-Day.

programme.title: Nazi Victory: The Post-War Plan
programme.desc: A look at Hitler's plans to build ambitious new cities in the countries he conquered, as well as schemes to transform Berlin to serve as a global capital city.

programme.title: Underground Worlds
programme.desc: An underground city beneath a forest in Northern France built to house 3,000 people, an ice cave under Iceland's biggest glacier, and a subterranean power station in London.

programme.title: Impossible Railways
programme.desc: Since their meteoric rise in the 19th Century, railways have been at the forefront of modern engineering. They've conquered dizzying altitudes, wilderness, seas and cities..

programme.title: Secrets of Britain
programme.desc: The series examining some of the UK's landmarks continues, with a look at the history of subterranean London, uncovering Roman remains, plague pits and secret bunkers under the capital's streets.

programme.title: Walking Through History
programme.desc: Tony Robinson sets off on a 45-mile hike through the countryside of the Weald in Kent and the Downs of East Sussex to discover the area's rich and surprising Tudor heritage. At Penshurst Place, author Philippa Gregory helps him relish the fate of the Grand Duke of Buckingham at the hands of the young Henry VIII. From there, he travels up what used to be secret paths to Hever Castle and finds out how the monarch's reign brought not only huge social, political and industrial change, but also fame and disaster to the women who caught his eye He ends this leg of his journey in Lewes, where he relives one of the more brutal monastic dissolutions.

programme.title: Underground Worlds
programme.desc: An underground city beneath a forest in Northern France built to house 3,000 people, an ice cave under Iceland's biggest glacier, and a subterranean power station in London.

programme.title: Impossible Railways
programme.desc: Since their rise in the 19th century, railways have been at the forefront of modern engineering and transport, conquering dizzying altitudes, wilderness, seas and cities.

programme.title: Secret Nazi Bases
programme.desc: The Spanish island of Villa Winter, which was suspected of being a port for German U-boats and part of a larger plan to invade the United States.

programme.title: Nazi Victory: The Post-War Plan
programme.desc: Hitler's plans to invade the US using battleships, long-range bombers and secret infiltrators. Plus, a look at support for the Nazi movement in America during the 1940s.

programme.title: Underground Worlds
programme.desc: The underground bases built by the German army during the occupation of Jersey, and a group of more than 20 underground cities in Turkey, one of which dates back to 800BC.

programme.title: Impossible Engineering
programme.desc: A look at the incredible machines built to get troops directly to the front line, on land, at sea and in the air.

programme.title: Porridge
programme.desc: Crafty con Fletcher helps new inmate Godber settle in by giving him a few lessons on coping with prison life. First episode of the classic comedy, originally broadcast in 1974, starring Ronnie Barker and Richard Beckinsale.

programme.title: Porridge
programme.desc: Betting fever sweeps Slade Prison, but the stakes rise too high for some of the inmates, stretching honour among thieves to the limit. Vintage comedy, starring Ronnie Barker and Richard Beckinsale.

programme.title: Porridge
programme.desc: Fletcher helps cellmate Godber make it through the night, calling on his unpredictable and limitless imagination to while away the hours. Classic comedy, starring Ronnie Barker and Richard Beckinsale.

programme.title: Impossible Railways
programme.desc: Since their rise in the 19th century, railways have been at the forefront of modern engineering and transport, conquering dizzying altitudes, wilderness, seas and cities.

programme.title: Underground Worlds
programme.desc: The underground bases built by the German army during the occupation of Jersey, and a group of more than 20 underground cities in Turkey, one of which dates back to 800BC.

programme.title: Waking the Dead
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. The body of police hero Debbie Britten washes up in the Thames a year after she disappeared, summoning the Cold Case unit to investigate. Initially, suspicion falls on a stalker, but the plot thickens further with the discovery that Debbie was pregnant at the time of her murder. Trevor Eve, Sue Johnston, Holly Aird and Tessa Peake-Jones star.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: The spectre of racial unrest looms over Sun Hill following a number of assaults on the Muslim community, allegedly committed by white youths. Hoping to defuse the situation, Leela persuades her father to tell the police he witnessed an Asian man carry out one of the attacks - and later finds him beaten senseless. As the three officers killed in the explosion are laid to rest, Neil arouses his wife's suspicions by attending Andrea's funeral, while Laura is unconvinced by Gabriel's whiter-than-white demeanour.

programme.title: London's Burning
programme.desc: Tragedy ensues when the team are called to a fire in a car park.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Soldier, Soldier
programme.desc: Marsha loses some of the nursery fund's money, and attracts suspicion when the other mothers notice her son has an expensive new bike.

programme.title: Soldier, Soldier
programme.desc: Romance blossoms between Lieutenant Kate Butler and an officer from another unit. Meanwhile, Glory is not on the cards for Luke Roberts.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: The spectre of racial unrest looms over Sun Hill following a number of assaults on the Muslim community, allegedly committed by white youths. Hoping to defuse the situation, Leela persuades her father to tell the police he witnessed an Asian man carry out one of the attacks - and later finds him beaten senseless. As the three officers killed in the explosion are laid to rest, Neil arouses his wife's suspicions by attending Andrea's funeral, while Laura is unconvinced by Gabriel's whiter-than-white demeanour.

programme.title: Holby City
programme.desc: It's the day of Owen's court hearing, where he hopes to gain regular access to his daughter - but he turns up late after an emergency and is accused of being too impulsive by Lauren. Mark celebrates his birthday and Chrissie prepares a surprise reunion with his father, though things don't work out as planned. Zubin takes to parenthood like a duck to water, but Jess is finding it hard to cope with looking after the baby.

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: Mark's condition still gives cause for concern, while George suspects a patient's wife may not be telling the truth. Meanwhile, Tina considers sharing a flat with new fun-loving colleague Chloe and a robbery causes problems for Sally.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Leela urges her hospitalised father to make a statement about his attackers, and is warned her own life is in danger - which only increases her determination to pursue the case to the bitter end. Jo goes on the trail of a violent pimp and offers a local prostitute the chance to become a police informant, while Gabriel shows his compassionate side by protecting a little girl he suspects is being abused. Honey brushes aside Yvonne's concerns about her engagement to Scott, putting it down to jealousy - unaware of Yvonne's budding romance with A&E nurse Nick.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Mark tells Arthur and Pauline he's looking for a flat. Dot is outraged at the possibility of a homeless person sleeping rough in the Square.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Mandy finds a new home, Pete gets an award at the Market Traders' Christmas Ball, and Tricky Dicky wins a prize - and then asks Kathy to share it with him.

programme.title: London's Burning
programme.desc: Bayleaf grows more concerned about his daughter's whereabouts and hires a private investigator to recover her. Meanwhile, the team are called out to help an elderly man.

programme.title: Monarch of the Glen
programme.desc: A valuable barrel of rare whisky causes discord on the estate, with Archie, Hector and Kilwillie each having his own idea on how best to dispose of it, and the pending appointment of a Head Ranger does little to clear the air. Light-hearted drama, starring Richard Briers, Alastair MacKenzie and Julian Fellowes.

programme.title: Bergerac
programme.desc: A man contacts Bergerac after he is subjected to a hate campaign by two bogus policemen who put pressure on him using his shady past. He refuses to co-operate - until his daughter Joanna is kidnapped. Detective drama, guest starring Lynsey Baxter, with John Nettles.

programme.title: Bread
programme.desc: Adrian receives a letter from an 18-year-old fan of his poems and arranges to meet her. Mrs Boswell meets up with Derek again.

programme.title: Hi-de-Hi!
programme.desc: Jeffrey adds another string to his bow by filling in for the local vicar. Campsite comedy, starring Simon Cadell, Jeffrey Holland, Ruth Madoc and Paul Shane.

programme.title: As Time Goes By
programme.desc: Jean does a spot of snooping on her potential neighbours when the house next door goes up for sale. Judi Dench and Geoffrey Palmer star.

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.sub-title: The Mischievous Tinkle in Howard's Eyes
programme.desc: Howard hopes to revolutionise the animal-watching community by introducing mobile phones to their repertoire of tools. However, he quickly discovers the gadget is not exactly suited to the silent nature of the hobby, and tries to find another way to contact his friends. Sitcom, starring Robert Fyfe.

programme.title: Hetty Wainthropp Investigates
programme.desc: A victimised German pensioner in a residential home asks Hetty to help trace his long-lost sister. Intent on setting the world to rights, the tenacious sleuth soon finds the elderly gentleman has a few surprises in store. Detective drama, starring Patricia Routledge, Richard Pasco and Suzanne Maddock.

programme.title: Ms Fisher's Modern Murder Mysteries
programme.desc: Peregrine bites off more than she expected while investigating a murder at an international cookery school, exposing a maze of corruption that leads back to the Melbourne police.

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: Standing and the team reinvestigate the 50-year-old murder of Frederick Tully, a wages clerk at Battersea Power Station. Discovering new evidence that leads them to doubt the man executed for the crime was guilty, they question the validity of the original case against him. Drama, guest starring George Cole, Roy Hudd and Jan Francis.

programme.title: Waking the Dead
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. When the only living victim of a jailed serial killer starts being harassed by a stalker, Boyd is given the chance to prove his theory that the murderer had a partner who is still on the loose. Starring Trevor Eve and Sue Johnston.

programme.title: Tyson Fury: The Gypsy King
programme.desc: The heavyweight celebrates a victory over Tom Schwarz in Las Vegas by enjoying a night of heavy drinking back home in Morecambe and video-calling rival Anthony Joshua. This angers his wife Paris, who is reminded of his alcohol abuse during his years of depression, and Fury looks to make amends by treating the family to a day out in Blackpool and booking a family holiday. The boxer then heads to Marbella with trainer Ben Davison, before preparing to face his next opponent Otto Wallin back in Vegas, in what proves to be a challenging fight.

programme.title: James Martin's French Adventure
programme.desc: The chef visits the port of Marseille, where the fishermen are selling fresh seafood from the back of their boats, and buys sea bass for an outdoor cook on the waterside. James also takes his beloved 2CV to the world-famous Circuit Paul Ricard to cook his take on Piperade.

programme.title: ITV Nightscreen
programme.desc: Text-based information service.

programme.title: Judge Rinder
programme.desc: Cameras follow criminal barrister Robert Rinder as he takes on real-life cases in a studio courtroom.

programme.title: Good Morning Britain
programme.desc: Morning magazine featuring a lively mix of news and current affairs, plus health, entertainment and lifestyle features.

programme.title: Lorraine
programme.desc: Entertainment, current affairs and fashion news, as well as showbiz stories and celebrity gossip. Presented by Lorraine Kelly.

programme.title: This Morning
programme.desc: A mix of celebrity chat, lifestyle features, advice and competitions.

programme.title: Loose Women
programme.desc: Another helping of topical studio discussion from a female perspective, featuring celebrity interviews.

programme.title: STV News and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast.

programme.title: Judge Rinder
programme.desc: Cameras follow criminal barrister Robert Rinder as he takes on real-life cases in a studio courtroom.

programme.title: Tenable
programme.desc: Quiz hosted by Warwick Davis in which five members of a ukulele band answer questions about top 10 lists from the realms of pop culture and general knowledge, then try to score a perfect 10 in the final round to take home the prize money.

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Ben Shephard hosts the quiz in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a 10,000 jackpot.

programme.title: The Chase
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as contestants Richard, Kati, Lisa and Geoff pit their wits against ruthless quiz genius the Chaser in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. They work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught.

programme.title: STV News at Six and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast.

programme.title: Party Political Broadcast
programme.desc: By the Scottish Labour Party.

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: Long-running soap following the ups and downs of village life amid the rolling scenery of the Yorkshire Dales.

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: Long-running drama with the residents of England's most famous cobbled street.

programme.title: Harry Redknapp's Sandbanks Summer
programme.desc: Harry Redknapp welcomes Nick Knowles and Rita Simons to Sandbanks, where they pay a visit to the nearby British Beach Polo Championships, and even get the chance to sit in a saddle. The following day, Harry visits his neighbour, celebrity interior designer Celia Sawyer, who gives him a tour of her harbour-front house.

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: Long-running drama with the residents of England's most famous cobbled street.

programme.title: The Trouble with Maggie Cole
programme.desc: Six-part drama following the lives of residents in the close-knit coastal resort of Thurlbury. Local historian Maggie Cole is flattered when she is interviewed for a radio show about village life, but she inadvertently shares too much detail about the locals and their private lives. Starring Dawn French and Julie Hesmondhalgh.

programme.title: ITV News at Ten
programme.desc: A fresh perspective on the major stories of the day, featuring national and international news, with reports and analysis from ITV's correspondents.

programme.title: Scotland Tonight
programme.desc: Current affairs show that tackles the issues behind the headlines from a Scottish perspective.

programme.title: Peston
programme.desc: Political magazine show presented by Robert Peston, featuring major interviews with MPs, topical guests and cultural figures. Including updates from social media taking in perspectives from viewers, experts and key players throughout the programme.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: A look at the process behind the making of cheddar, widely considered the world's most popular cheese. Plus, the mechanisms inside Resusci Anne - the learning aid used to teach CPR.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Smart city car the Fiat Panda is also a surprisingly good off-road hack. Mike Brewer tracks down a 4x4 model with potential, passing the vehicle on to mechanic Edd China, as the pair try to turn a profit improving its credentials before selling it on.

programme.title: Outback Truckers
programme.desc: In the final stages of transporting cargo to Micronesia, Mark faces volatile weather and unstable roads. Plus, Brad contracts to move a road building camp deep in the Outback.

programme.title: American Chopper
programme.desc: The team builds a customised bike for Klipsch Audio Technologies, but staffing problems force Paul Teutul Sr to redouble his search for new employeess.

programme.title: Fantomworks
programme.desc: Dan thinks that Mickey's 1970 Chevelle is perfect, but Mickey wants upgrade everything. Thom's 1963 Studebaker is a nightmare combination of leaks and bad parts.

programme.title: Dirty Jobs
programme.desc: Mike Rowe heads to Windsorland Mobile Home Park, where he finds the production of mannequins is not only dirty but also difficult.

programme.title: How It's Made
programme.desc: The processes involved in the creation of clay, pitted prunes and spurs.

programme.title: How It's Made
programme.desc: The processes involved in the creation of tasers, canned soup and diving boards, and how they have developed over the years.

programme.title: FBI Case Files
programme.desc: When FBI Special Agent Mike Clarke begins an Albanian serial murder investigation, his efforts lead to the Bronx, New york, and the unsolved murder of Mary Beal.

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: Police turn to a rare fingerprinting technique to solve the case of a murdered woman discovered in an Ohio field.

programme.title: Crime Stories
programme.desc: The murder of a prostitute in Saskatchewan, Canada, a case in which the police investigation led to two unlikely possible culprits.

programme.title: Murder Comes to Town
programme.desc: A case in which a 21-year-old mother failed to return from night classes, before her car was found burned out. Investigators immediately suspected foul play, but no one was prepared for the web of lies that unravelled following her disappearance.

programme.title: FBI Files
programme.desc: One year after the original crime, new clues emerge regarding the location of the suspects in an armed home invasion during which a police officer was shot.

programme.title: Animal Cops Phoenix
programme.desc: While the Arizona Humane Society helps a boxer fight for life, medical technician Traci Pepper takes her home and nurses her back to health.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: A look at the work of Sydney veterinary surgeon Dr Chris Brown and his most embarrassing cases, including a golden retriever that has developed a nasty condition.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Julie and her mother cannot hold back when it comes to their brutal opinions, while brides-to-be Joy and Beth have high expectations.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Tony Danza arrives at the salon to help his Broadway co-star find the perfect bridal costume for her role in their new musical, Honeymoon in Vegas.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: A customer who committed to a dress after seeing a drawing prepares to try on the real thing, and a mother does not make another customer's shopping trip easy.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Dr Chris Brown travels to the Barossa Valley in South Australia to help an orphan lamb. Plus, Tim Faulkner learns about a breeding programme for the Tasmanian Devil.

programme.title: Animal Cops Phoenix
programme.desc: Investigator Racelle Carlson faces the challenge of checking on a house full of dogs. Two brothers live there, but at first they won't let anyone inside the property.

programme.title: Animal Cops Phoenix
programme.desc: An elderly woman's cats have to be taken into care after Racelle Carlson finds her living in unhealthy conditions surrounded by 60 of the animals.

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: Sarah Moore salvages a chest of drawers, a kitchen worktop and three chairs from being discarded in Stockport, and attempts to make a profit through renovating them.

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: How the Texas Rangers have progressed from a group to protect settlers in the 19th century to a sophisticated law-enforcement agency.

programme.title: Disappeared
programme.desc: The case of mother-of-four Amber Gerweck who went missing in April 2011. Her car was found in Georgia, 600 miles from her home, and when Amber eventually reappeared she claimed to have no recollection of events over the previous three weeks.

programme.title: Disappeared
programme.desc: The disappearance of reporter, part-time dancer and single mother Susan Walsh, who vanished from outside her New Jersey home in 1996, leaving her son behind.

programme.title: Murder Comes to Town
programme.desc: The murder of retailer Harvey Fuson in January 2011. The 66-year-old was well-loved by members of his local community and the manner of his death shocked the Tennessee town of Cumberland Gap as well as the entire Tri-State area.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: UK
programme.desc: A bride is unable to find the dress she wants and changes her plans, but her entourage are not sure it is a good idea. Another customer wants a backless frock.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: UK
programme.desc: Kayleigh wants something princess-worthy, while Bec is in panic mode with last minute adjustments.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: UK
programme.desc: Elisha wants bling on her gown, but is when is enough 'too much'? Meanwhile, Elizabeth wants a dress that looks fabulous and lets her to shake it on the dancefloor.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: UK
programme.desc: A woman who has recently lost a lot of weight and a new mother both want a dress that shows off their new figure.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: UK
programme.desc: Two brides comes to the store for their first time shopping for a wedding dress. Older bride Francis seeks an elegant, age-appropriate dress, and Donna wants a slim-fitting gown.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: UK
programme.desc: From 'shy Di' to the queen of chic, Princess Diana will forever be an icon. Bride Uwa wants a Diana-inspired gown, while Chantelle wants a more contemporary look.

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: Sarah Moore salvages a chest of drawers, a kitchen worktop and three chairs from being discarded in Stockport, and attempts to make a profit through renovating them.

programme.title: Posh Pawnbrokers
programme.desc: At Pickwick Pawnbrokers in London, Nathan and his sidekick Debbs seal the deals on an unusual life-size Majolica lion, a rare book and racing silks owned by jockey AP McCoy. Meanwhile, at Dan's London Road Shop in Sheffield, the team values a selection of high-end rubies and an unusual astronaut jukebox.

programme.title: My 600lb Life
programme.desc: Part one of two. At over 600lbs each, Vianey and Allen are in a co-dependent relationship based on a shared love of food. Can they conquer their addiction together?.

programme.title: Long Lost Family Australia
programme.desc: With only a hospital bracelet and a box of photos, 20-year-old Shantelle searches for her older sister. Plus, 46-year-old Natalieann looks for her father, who she hasn't seen since they stopped talking 24 years earlier. Presented by Chrissie Swan and Anh Do.

programme.title: Body Bizarre
programme.desc: Two brothers from Peru with stunted growth who are the size of toddlers despite being in their late teens.

programme.title: FBI Case Files
programme.desc: Texas police join an FBI investigation into the kidnapping of a 16-year-old girl by a drug-trafficking gang.
